description: From Middle English bigiften (“to entrust”), equivalent to be- +‎ gift. Cognate with Dutch begiften (“to endow”), German begaben (“to endow”), Swedish begåva (“to endow, dower”).

verbs.description: begift (third-person singular simple present begifts, present participle begifting, simple past and past participle begifted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give a gift or gifts to; bestow or present with gifts.
examples: If you are an occasional reader and would like to receive the magazine regularly — or if you are a subscriber and would like to begift a friend, colleague or relative — use the form below.
